intro: Armeria hispalensis, commonly known as the HISPANIC THIMBLEWEED, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and northern Africa. It is a member of the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are typically linear and covered in fine, soft hairs. Armeria hispalensis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
